answers.author: Brenda Rogers
answers.text:
Manatee County, Florida we are trying to engage a team of Ambassadors and would be very interested in the answers to the questions posed.  Currently, we are using the "6 Qualities Linked to Innovation" series as a tool to gather interested employees.  The plan is that the next one will be hosted by ambassadors at a number of work sites as we try to expose the value of the webinar program to our employees, thus introducing staff to the many resources available.  As a group, we've met somewhat sporadically, as we find purpose, establish goals, and see success the enthusiasm grows.

answers.author: Vickie Atkinson
answers.text:
The City of Durham, NC is also planning to engage a team of Ambassadors and to use the "6 Qualities of Innovation" as a tool for convening the group. Our existing cross-departmental DurhamFirst Steering Team is spearheading the effort. In addition to viewing the webinars together, we are converting a Quarterly Lunch and Learn with the City Manager (that targeted graduates of our Leadership Development programs) to quarterly lunch meetings that will focus on innovation in our organization. These meetings will be open to everyone who has signed up to be an ambassador. We're just getting underway and look forward to learning what others are doing.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
A CA City is starting their new internal Ambassador Team and is wondering how other member agencies are using their Ambassador Teams. 
Do you have an Ambassador team? If so:
How are you organized?
Do you meet regularly?
What are the goals or objectives of the team?
Do you have any documentation (policies, etc.) how the team was formed, how it will operate etc.?
Your thoughts, opinions and ideas are welcomed!
